label: The Queen was born at 2:40 in the morning of April 21, 1926, at 17 Bruton Street in the Mayfair district of London - as Princess Elizabeth Alexandra Mary. What nickname did her parents give her?
She is the longest-serving monarch in British history: How long has Elizabeth II been on the throne?
Boris Johnson is the 14th prime minister Elizabeth II has seen as queen. Who was in office when she ascended the throne?
During World War II, 'Elizabeth Windsor' served with the Auxiliary Territorial Service (ATS). What training did she receive with the Women's Division of the British Army?
On November 20, 1947, Elizabeth married Prince Philip. What was the family relationship between the two?

choices.value: They were great niece and great uncle

label: Queen Elizabeth II has four children. Put them in the right order from oldest to youngest?

choices.value: Prince Charles, Princess Anne, Prince Edward, Prince Andrew
Prince Charles, Prince Andrew, Princess Anne, Prince Edward
Prince Charles, Princess Anne, Prince Andrew, Prince Edward

label: The Queen on her first visit to Germany in 1965. Which German president stood with her on the balcony of Bonn City Hall?
What did Elizabeth officially do for the first time in 1998?

choices.value: She went to a pub for the first time
She rode the subway for the first time
She paid income taxes for the first time

label: How many rooms does Buckingham Palace have?
Which year did Queen Elizabeth II refer to as annus horribilis (year of horror)?
When Michelle Obama was a guest at Buckingham Palace in 2009, she broke court protocol: What faux pas did the then First Lady of the United States make?

choices.value: She put an arm around the Queen's shoulder
She wore a dress with spaghetti straps
She ignored the request to shake hands with the Queen

label: In 2012, the year of her diamond jubilee on the throne, Elizabeth II opened the Summer Olympics in London. She had opened Olympic Games before, which one?
